t: Job 36
Elihu Proclaims God’s Goodness
Elihu*p also proceeded and said:
“Bear*pn with me a little, and I will show you That*ld there*i are*i yet words to speak on God’s behalf.
I*ld will fetch my knowledge from afar; I*ld will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
For*ld truly my words are*i not false; One*ld who is perfect in knowledge is*i with you.
“Behold,*ln God is*i mighty, but despises no*i one;*i He*ild is*i mighty in strength of understanding.
He*ld does not preserve the life of the wicked, But*ld gives justice to the oppressed.
He*ld does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous; But*ld they*i are*i on the throne with kings, For*ld He has seated them forever, And*ld they are exalted.
And*ld if they*i are*i bound in fetters, Held*ld in the cords of affliction,
Then*ld He tells them their work and their transgressions— That*ld they have acted defiantly.
He*ld also opens their ear to instruction, And*ld commands that they turn from iniquity.
If*ld they obey and serve Him,*i They*ld shall spend their days in prosperity, And*ld their years in pleasures.
But*ld if they do not obey, They*ld shall perish by the sword, And*ld they shall die without knowledge.
“But*ln the hypocrites in heart store up wrath; They*ld do not cry for help when He binds them.
They*ld die in youth, And*ld their life ends*i among the perverted persons.
He*ld delivers the poor in their affliction, And*ld opens their ears in oppression.
“Indeed*ln He would have brought you out of dire distress, Into*ild a broad place where there*i is*i no restraint; And*ld what is set on your table would*i be*i full of richness.
But*ld you are filled with the judgment due the wicked; Judgment*ld and justice take hold of*i you.*i
Because*ld there*i is*i wrath, beware*i lest He take you away with one*i blow; For*ld a large ransom would not help you avoid it.*i
Will*ld your riches, Or*ld all the mighty forces, Keep*ld you from distress?
Do*ld not desire the night, When*ld people are cut off in their place.
Take*ld heed, do not turn to iniquity, For*ld you have chosen this rather than affliction.
“Behold,*ln God is exalted by His power; Who*ld teaches like Him?
Who*ld has assigned Him His way, Or*ld who has said, ‘You have done wrong’?
Elihu Proclaims God’s Majesty
“Remember*pn to magnify His work, Of*ld which men have sung.
Everyone*ld has seen it; Man*ld looks on it*i from afar.
“Behold,*ln God is*i great, and we do not know Him;*i Nor*ld can the number of His years be*i discovered.
For*ld He draws up drops of water, Which*ld distill as rain from the mist,
Which*ld the clouds drop down And*ild pour abundantly on man.
Indeed,*ld can anyone*i understand the spreading of clouds, The*ld thunder from His canopy?
Look,*ld He scatters His light upon it, And*ld covers the depths of the sea.
For*ld by these He judges the peoples; He*ld gives food in abundance.
He*ld covers His*i hands with lightning, And*ld commands it to strike.
His*ld thunder declares it, The*ld cattle also, concerning the rising storm.*i
